Title: Quality Secondhand Bikes For Sale -- Restored to Like New Condition!
text: I have several used bicycles available in various sizes. (Bikes in this ad are sold.) I have mostly commuters or mountain bikes as well as a few road bikes in the $200-300 range. I was professionally trained as a bike mechanic. Now in my spare time I enjoy restoring and fixing up bikes to bring them new life and add value to our community in Boulder. Most of the bikes have new shifters, tires, grips, etc. and some have been substantially upgraded. The  majority of my bikes are brand names like Trek, Giant, Gary Fisher, Specialized, Bianchi, GT, & Diamondback.   Reach out if you're looking for a quality bike in excellent condition and don't want to add to the consumer stream or pay sticker price for a new one. Title: Bike Hitch Rack (up to 4 bikes)- by Yakima
NS Bikes Dirt Jump Wheelset (single speed) w / Tires
text: NS Bikes Dirt Jump Wheelset (single speed), Specialized Rhythm Lite Tires – 26” Axles: FW: 20x110mm | RW: 10x135mm Bolt-On – black Came off 2018-2019 NS Dirt Jump bike. Very little use, straight rims, no dings/etc Includes disc brake rotor Wheelset has Stay Tru Single Speed hub with 10 tooth cog driver *    *Note: Stay Tru hubs use their own 10 tooth driver and there are no replacements available. As such, you will need to run a BMX style (not mountain bike) crank so you can run a small enough front chainring to have a gear ratio that is in normal dirt jumper range.  You can’t get a mountain bike chainring smaller than 28 tooth and this with the 10 tooth driver is really too much gear for dirt jumping. With the BMX style crank you can drop into the low 20 tooth size chainrings and get the gear you need.

Title: SPOT BRAND MAYHEM CARBON MOUNTAIN BIKE
text: 2018 SPOT Mayhem Carbon mountain bike. The bike is currently with me in Tahoe, but I’m heading to Boulder/Denver area on May 1 to pick up my daughter from CU and I can bring the bike with me and deliver it to purchaser. Bought it at the end of 2018 and first ridden in Spring 2019, so it has only be ridden for 3 Tahoe seasons and not year-round. If you’re not familiar with this brand, do just a little research and you will find nothing but glowing reviews by bike publications and individuals alike. They are based in Golden,CO and only sell direct so you won’t find these in any local bike shop. They are a small producer of bikes that offer all-round fun on the trails and especially excel at climbing. I love this bike soooo much that I just bought another one to replace it. I just had it fully serviced by Spot last spring and didn’t get a lot of riding last season because of the horrendous smoke last summer, so it’s in great riding condition. If you’re not a down hill basher but in the market for a high-end, full carbon “boutique” trail mtb. than do a little research and take this one for a spin. This is a medium frame that should work for approximate heights of 5’4 - 5’10” (depending on your individual proportions). Title: Specialized Allez Performance Road Bike 58cm
text: Specialized Allez Performance Road Bicycle  Excellent Condition  DA16 - Alexrims Shimano Tiagra Rear Shimano Sora Front Felt Seat Post Cobb Cycling Seat Scott Aero Bars  XL Frame Size 58cm  Located in South Boulder  ALLEZ  Whether you're just getting into road cycling, commuting, or just looking for a new bike, the Allez is the perfect choice. Featuring a lightweight alloy frame, carbon fiber fork, and mounts for racks and fenders, it's as performance-packed as it is versatile.  Not only does a light bike feel better when you're climbing up a hill, but it's also essential when you're carrying your bike up to the 5th floor, and this was at the forefront of the frame design. With a redesigned E5 Alloy frame, the Allez features a class-leading weight. Aggressively thin-walled, yet tough, tubes have been implemented to save weight and this results in over a 450g (1-pound) reduction in the frame and fork alone when compared to some models of yesteryear.  Speaking of the fork, entry-level road bikes often times feature either alloy or cheap carbon fiber forks that greatly detract from the overall ride quality. But with a full FACT carbon fiber fork, the Allez is better handling, smoother riding, and lower in weight—floating over rough chip-seal and carving through corners like a slalom skier. For the geometry, we developed the Allez by utilizing our vast Retül fit database. This meant creating a geometry that's sure to cover a broad range of positions, while still providing the performance-minded handling you'd expect from your first bike.  This Allez also features integrated rack and fender mounts, allowing you to get weight of your backpack of you and onto a lightweight rack. This not only makes for a good road bike, but it also enables you to transform it into a fast commuter. And for the build, this Allez features reliable Shimano Claris shifting, durable Axis Sport alloy wheels, and well-protected Espoir Sport tires.  E5 Premium Aluminum frame features fully manipulated tubing with Smooth Welds that increase stiffness and efficiency, while looking just as good as it performs.  Specialized FACT carbon, full monocoque fork designed for high-speed handling.

Title: Yakima Front Loader Upright Bike Carrier
170" 2016 Mercedes Benz Sprinter Van 2500
text: Are you jonesing for your next adventure and looking for a turnkey sprinter van to do it in?   This van has literally been home to me at times. I'm needing to sell only to free up some cash to go back to school. No mechanical issues and service every 20,000 miles per MB spec.   Last service was around 142,000 where I had the oil changed, fuel filter replaced, AC Compressor replaced, put on brand new tie rods, and new rear leaf springs for better handling with a heavy load.   This van has all you need and a bit more. Don't shy away from 140k in miles - as long as you treat her nicely, she'll go for 400k+ on diesel.   - Electrical system is a 12v Direct Current (DC) system. A battery is used to 1) store and 2) produce energy on demand to the electrical appliances in the vehicle. ----- with respect to storage of power, the battery stores power produced by the solar panel, vehicle alternator and 'shore-power'.   - Insulation/Walls/Floor: sound deadening mats across entire body and entire cab along with a 2.5" aluminum backed polyisocyanate as insulation on all walls and ceilings. Fire retardant foam (in addition to polyiso) was used on the floor to seal all cracks. Walls are covered with 1/2 inch 13-ply baltic birch plywood (cabinet grade) ceiling is 1/4" ply. Floor is tongue and groove waterproof faux wood with a nice grain texture.   - Cabinetry: all cabinets and storage were built using 1/2" 13 ply baltic birch plywood. Extremely strong and durable, hugh ply baltic birch plywood is the gold standard for high-end cabinetry.   - Plumbing: An Ikea Vessel sink attaches to a 7 gallon gray water system. A dual action hand pump delivers water from a 7 gallon fresh water container and storage under the sink includes a second 7 gallon fresh water tank.   - Stove: three burner stove with oven.   - Refrigerator: enormous for a van at 130L. Truckfridge with Danfoss compressor.   - Electrical: 200 Amp -hour LiFePO4 battery; 40 amp hour MPPT Controller; 2000 pure sine inverter (AIMS power); 60 amp LiFePO4 battery charger/converter (progressive dynamics); 265W monocrystalline solar panel; 40amp DC to DC battery charger; battery monitor; 4 AC outlets; 12 USB outlets; LED strip lighting and LED can lights; cell phone signal booster (WeBoost); Gallo acoustics speakers  - Dinette/table/bed: 4 person booth with a removable custom table. Table can be removed and an included piece of wood can be used to turn this into a mini bed (sleeps someone up to 5'10") or giant dog bed  - Queen bed/storage: excellent tuft and needle memory foam mattress comes with comforter and pillows. Underneath bed is the storage area that can fit a couple of mountain bikes, crash pads, skis, boards and more!

ALL TRAILERS MUST BE DELIVERED AS THEY COME STRAIGHT FROM THE FACTORY TO YOUR FRONT DOOR 15% DEPOSIT REQUIRED     There are several uses for a utility trailer. Here is a glimpse at just the top ten uses of utility trailers:  1.Automobiles: From time to time it becomes necessary to haul an inoperable car or truck. Tow trucks are expensive, especially if the distance is great. A utility trailer is a great way to haul vehicles and a good investment if you need to do so regularly.  2.Boats: If you have a boat, you will need a utility trailer to get it to and from the water.  3.Lawn Care Equipment: If you live in a rural area, you may find that you need to haul your mowing equipment from one piece of your property to another. Packing equipment and loading it into a pickup truck bed can get old very quickly. A utility trailer will allow you to drive your equipment right up onto the trailer without the aid of ramps or two strong men.  4.Furniture: Moving furniture is a breeze with a utility trailer. Furniture dollies roll right up onto the trailer and you can haul more than you can with a pickup.  5.Building Supplies: Do you have projects that need to be done around the house? Pick up your own building supplies and save on delivery fees.  6.Bikes, Motorcycles, and ATVs: Recreational vehicles are best hauled on a utility trailer.  7.Livestock: An enclosed utility trailer is most often used to haul livestock.  8.Auction and Flea Markets: If you frequent auctions and flea markets, you will need the hauling capability to bring home your inexpensive and rare finds.  9.Appliances: Utility trailers are ideal for hauling appliances.  10.Debris and Trash: Loading trash in and out of your pickup bed can be cumbersome and clean up can be messy, but it would be worse to have to haul trash in your SUV. Clean up after a big job is a lot easier with a utility trailer.  As you can see, there are many reasons why an investment in a utility trailer is a smart move. I'm sure that with a little time, and its easy availability, you will come up with even more ways to use a trailer  ATV UTV SXS MOTORCYCLE BIKE TRANSPORT HAUL MOVE CAR TRUCK MOVING TRAVELING STORAGE Title: ***MOSAIC TITANIUM GRAVEL BIKE***
text: I received this bike in January 2022 and probably don't even have 200 miles on it, but sadly I am forced to sell due to a chronic neck injury forcing me to give up cycling unless I want to go through surgery. Ugh.   Consequently, this is your chance to snag an essentially brand-new Mosaic GT-1 45 medium-sized frame with a "no-expense-spared" build full of nearly impossible to find components--just in time for Spring with no 5 month wait!   See pics for geo, but this is essentially a stock sized 54cm-55cm GT-1 frame with the only tweak being a slightly steeper top-tube angle to allow for more standover clearance. I'm 5'8" and have owned a zillion bikes, but this is easily the best handling frame geo I've ever ridden. It just works on every terrain imaginable from gravel roads to carving paved descents. Plenty of room to dial in your fit. There are 2.5cm of spacers under the stem, and the Pro handle bar has an extremely short reach and shallow drop, so you could easily go longer and lower if you like.   Full Build: Frameset: Mosaic GT1-45 ($7,400) Fork: Enve  Headset: Chris King i7  Wheels: Enve AG25 Carbon ($1,900) Tires: Rene Herse 42mm Hurricane Ridge Extralight ($200) Shifters / Brakes: SRAM Force AXS ($719) Rotors: SRAM Centerline X 160mm ($105) Rear Derailleur: SRAM Force XPLR 1x12 ($382) Cassette: SRAM Force XPLR 10-44 12 speed ($223) Chain: SRAM Force AXS ($60) Crank: Cane Creek eeWings Titanium 170mm ($1,200) Chainring: Wolftooth Oval 40T ($85) Bottom Bracket: Cane Creek Hellbender 70 ($100) Battery/Charger: SRAM ($100) Seatpost: Enve Carbon 27.2 ($250) Bar: Shimano Pro Discover Alloy ($75) Tape: Lizard Skinz ($35) Stem: Enve Carbon 100mm ($250) Saddle: WTB Silverado Cro-Moly ($100) Cages: Wolf Tooth Titanium (x2): ($120) Build: Boulder Grupetto ($300) Total: $13,600+  Asking $12k, or best reasonable offer. PayPal negotiable. Lowballs and vague inquiries will be politely ignored.   keywords: Shimano di2 dura ace dura-ace xtr ultegra 105 campagnolo record super chorus red etap rival 1x zipp 303 404 202 firecrest 3.4ar 4.5ar g23 g25 ag28 cervelo aspero gravel bicycle moots routt firefly no. 22 ibis ripmo Ripley Pinarello grevil parlee Rapha specialized Roubaix diverge carbon Silca canyon seven rodeo labs flaanimal Traildonkey trail donkey mountain bike cross country xc triathlon Tri p5x p5 p3 cross cx mavic Reynolds litespeed steel Baum vamoots 45 rsc ybb womble rt-1 rt-1d gt2 gt2-45 gt1-45 gtx af

Title: 2021 Santa Cruz Tallboy A R - size L
Thule 518 Echelon Fork Mount Rooftop Bicycle Carrier
text: Used Thule fork mount rooftop bike carrier for sale.  Product Description from Amazon: The Thule Echelon Fork Mount Rooftop Bicycle Carrier is the top-of-the-line in Thule's fork mounted carrier series. It is designed to provide maximum stability and protection via a variety of valuable features including: a durable all-metal head, a stiff double-wall tray and an equalized twin cam self-adjusting clamp that automatically adjusts to fit a variety of fork dropout thicknesses. Additional features include: a stainless steel skewer with oversized lever for secure loading and unloading of front forks, an adjustable rear wheel strap, compatibility with wheelbases up to 48 inches and tire widths up to 2.6 inches and more. The ultimate in fork mount technology that's also ultra easy to install and use.  Key Features The Equalized Twin Cam self-adjusting clamp automatically adjusts to fit a variety of fork dropout thicknesses for a secure hold. Versatile design fits most disc brake and suspension combinations with standard 9mm axles. Precise ergonomic pressure dial optimizes force on dropouts increasing hold, and eliminating damage to fork. Aerodynamic, durable die-cast metal head for increased security and product life. Ratcheting wheel strap quickly secures back wheel to tray. Carries bikes with wheelbases up to 48 inches and tire widths up to 2.6 inches. Even works with high profile rims. Corrosion resistant double-wall aluminum tray provides maximum strength and rigidity. 1 One-Key lock cylinder (sold separately) locks the bike to carrier and carrier to rack. Fits Thule rack systems or other round bars. Factory rack compatible with Thule Ride-On Adapter (sold separately).  Specifications Load Capacity (bikes) - 1 Fits Tire Dimensions (in) - 2.6 inches Fits Thule Aero Profile - Yes (adapter required) Fits Square Bar - Yes Fits Most Bikes with Disc Brakes - Yes One Key System Compatible (locks sold separately) - Yes For Tandem Bikes - No Fork Dropout Compatibility - Between 4mm and 10mm thick; dropouts must be 100mm apart  For more info, see: https://www.amazon.com/Thule-518-Echelon-Rooftop-Bicycle/dp/B000MRFHBI  Note: Last four images are obviously not the actual product I am selling here on Craigslist. They are from a website showing descriptive images of a same/similar model product.

Title: Starcraft Launch 16RB Extreme:
text: The Launch 16RB Extreme: Don't let the end of the pavement be the end of your camping trip.    The “Extreme” means 5" extra ground clearance, leaf spring suspension, 15" Off-Road Mud Tires, enclosed underbelly, Flex-Foil insulation floor and roof, front black diamond plate, and a double entry step.  ( 1st photo is a brochure photo of a "regular" Launch )   This is light (3000lbs empty, I tow this with a ’06 Toyota LC) and big, dual queen sleepers and the table drops to another bed.  Tall interior, at 6’1” I don’t have to hunch to enjoy cooking in out of the rain.   Capacities: 26-gallon fresh, 6-gallon hot water, 15-gallon grey, 9-gallon black.  Storage space  (cubbies galore).  Everything you need:  2-Way frig/freezer, heater, 2-burner stove, A/C, microwave, and separate bathroom with toilet, stand-up shower, sunroof, and powered vent fan.  10ft powered awning, push the button it goes out, bush the button and it comes back – too easy.  LED lighting throughout.  We’ve used this camper mostly boon-docking off of remote Forest Service or BLM access roads, which opens up whole new worlds of adventure.  But, if you want to plug in for A/C, a microwave and heated bunk mats, you can.    Beyond the factory   EXTRAS:   Full extension drawers, no crawling to find pots under the stove. Shocks, yup real shocks, they don’t make it ride any higher but the make it tow much better – no bouncy bouncy :). Anti-sway bar, if you have ever towed ANYthing across I-80 through WY you’ll be glad you have an anti-sway bar.    Dual batteries, go ahead and leave the fan on :) 100w solar (one panel up; wired for two – but haven’t ever needed it) with wired-in inverter.  If the sun is out, the batteries are charging.  Kitchen backsplash tiles and magnetic knife holder.   400w inverter (it won’t power much, but sometimes having 110v is nice).  Extra USB ports.        Duel propane tanks.  Go for a 2 week trip, cook, and have some heat at 10,000ft (the nights can be chilly even in Aug). Spare tire mount on the tongue.  Rear bumper now has a carrier hitch for bikes. Outside plumbing for a quick rinse.   Outside gas connect for grilling outside (grill not included).     Dual tongue wheel for ease of movement. 1st and only owner, title in hand.   Link to NADA Guides & Specs: https://www.nadaguides.com/RVs/2016/Starcraft/M-16RB/6555257/Specs https://www.nadaguides.com/RVs/2016/Starcraft/M-16RB/6555257/Values  720 308 208three

Title: Liv Adore Kids Girls Toddler Bike Bicycle
text: These are high end aluminum kids bikes (light).  Our little girl had this from age 3-5 and it has light use.  They sell between $200-$300.    I misplaced the training wheels but have another set I can include.   Here is some info w the web link below  Her first two-wheeler and one of life's great experiences, the colorful Liv Adore makes it easy. Title: Biktrix Ultra FS electric bike
text: Selling my Biktrix Ultra FS full suspension electric mountain bike/commuter. Biktrix is a Canadian company, selling very high-end, reliable bikes. This ebike features the powerful Bafang M-620 Ultra motor which is among the strongest, most reliable motors available (160Nm torque). This is the popular mid-motor style featuring both pedal assist with torque and cadence sensing. This model also has a throttle, which comes in very handy when starting from a complete stop (no pedaling necessary). I have added approximately $2,000 in upgrades, including the battery which is a 48V/17.5ah (840WH), with an estimated 40 mile range. In order to facilitate year-round use, I have two sets of wheels/tires including 4" fat tires mounted on 26" rims (Kenda Juggernauts), and also 3" plus-size tires mounted on 27.5" rims (Schwalbe Rocket Rons). This ebike has hydraulic disc brakes with upgraded discs and pads. 52T Sram oversize chainring, 31.8 750mm riser handle bar, Adjustable stem (0 to 90 deg.), color-matched alloy platform pedals, Ergon GP1 grips, front and rear lights, and much more. Frame size is M/L. Fits riders 5'-4" to 6'-6". Call or text me for further details and to arrange test ride.

Title: S4 Specialized Stumpjumper Evo Comp Size Large w Tubeless + Pedals
text: In almost new/great condition with only 20 hours I have my 2021 Gloss Arctic Blue/Black Size S4 Specialized Stumpjumper Evo Comp for sale.   Comes with $200 black flat pedals + crank boots, new $60 specialized grips, and has been professionally converted to tubeless ($100). Cost over $6000 in Sept 2021 when I bought it at University Bikes in Boulder. All services were done there. Have receipts and University Bikes can confirm purchase etc for insurance (if you want to add to your home insurance). The bike has been registered with Specialized and has a multi year warranty.  The reason for selling is I liked this bike so much I have ordered the 'pro' version of it for this summers season since they are sold out during the warm season. The S4 sizing which is what they call large can easily fit a wide range of heights from 5'7" to 6'1". This size has been sold out for most of 2021 and 2022 and these bikes will have a 10% price increase for the coming season.  Serious inquiries only, can meet outside/inside Univercity Bikes or Trek Bike Shops in Boulder to show.  Specs here https://www.ubikes.com/product/specialized-stumpjumper-evo-comp-393924-1.htm

Title: Saris 3-Bike Rack
text: Saris bike rack with some extra securing straps. Four support legs. Holds 3 bikes. Minimally used. Part of one cradle is broken off but otherwise is in very good condition.

Title: Electra Betty 3 Speed Cruiser
text: Hello, I am Betty made by Electra bikes. I am a cruiser with an internal 3 speed hub. I was purchased in February 2007 for about $700.  Electra is not currently producing cool Betty bikes like me, so I consider myself pretty special.  My owner died this year so I was rescued and brought to Breakaway Cycles in Loveland for a tune-up and cleaning ($89.50). Breakaway did a great job of sprucing me up so I shift like new and have a new rear inner tube.   My the top tubes and rear fender have some scratches as my new owner tried to show in the photos.  I have an easily removable front basket, leather tassels on the grips, and dice valve covers to highlight my pink rims. I'm a super cool bike in great shape looking for a new owner that can take me out for rides. And even though I am not one of those e-bikes I promise I will not disappoint you!!

Title: Redline Road/Commuter Bike
text: Solid newly fixed up Redline Road/commuter/gravel bike. Bought at Community Cycles earlier this year for $700 and they fixed and tuned it all up including new tires. Good as new! Truly loved this bike because it rides smoothly and confidently around town without being too flashy for the bad guys looking to swipe. I am a 5'4 female and it fits me perfectly. Selling because I am moving and already have 3 bikes... Front/Rear lights not included.
